title: 24-hour clock
summary: The 24-hour clock, popularly referred to in the United States and some other countries as military time,[1][2] is the convention of timekeeping in which the day runs from midnight to midnight and is divided into 24 hours. This is indicated by the hours passed since midnight, from 0 to 23. This system is the most commonly used time notation in the world today,[1] and is used by the international standard ISO 8601.[3]
